maxo_def: A obo:IAO_0000115

The use of extreme cold to damage or destroy a body part, pathway, or function. The procedure is performed using small cryogenic probes during surgery, and has recently been applied to solitary sporadic renal tumor lesions.
ncit_def: The use of extreme cold to damage or destroy a body part, pathway, or function. The procedure is performed using small cryogenic probes during surgery, and has recently been applied to solitary sporadic renal tumor lesions.

maxo_def: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by chemical means.
ncit_def: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by chemical means.

maxo_def: The determination of the ratio of the prothrombin time in a subject's specimen compared to a control sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: The determination of the ratio of the prothrombin time in a subject's specimen compared to a control sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage.

maxo_def: A procedure to determine the number of cells in a clinical sample.
ncit_def: A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample. Also used to mean the result of such a procedure.

maxo_def: A technique in which sound waves are sent out by an ultrasound probe that has been inserted in the vagina and a computer uses the ultrasound echoes to create an image of the female genital tract. The test can be performed to evaluate women with infertility problems, abnormal bleeding, sources of unexplained pain, congenital malformations of the uterus and ovaries, and possible tumors and infection.
ncit_def: A technique in which sound waves are sent out by an ultrasound probe that has been inserted in the vagina and a computer uses the ultrasound echoes to create an image of the female genital tract. The test can be performed to evaluate women with infertility problems, abnormal bleeding, sources of unexplained pain, congenital malformations of the uterus and ovaries, and possible tumors and infection.

maxo_def: The determination of the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a blood sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a blood sample.

maxo_def: Examination of the cells in urine.
ncit_def: Examination of the cells in urine.

maxo_def: Total parenteral nutrition formulated for intravenous administration in patients who cannot eat or cannot get enough nutrients from the foods they eat.  It is a liquid mixture of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals and other nutrients.
ncit_def: Total parenteral nutrition formulated for intravenous administration in patients who cannot eat or cannot get enough nutrients from the foods they eat.  It is a liquid mixture of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals and other nutrients.

maxo_def: The determination of the amount of protein present in a urine sample. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: The determination of the amount of protein present in a urine sample.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

maxo_def: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant. Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).
ncit_def: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

maxo_def: Any alteration or treatment in an individual's diet with a planned goal, usually designed to improve the individual's overall health.
ncit_def: Any alteration or treatment in an individual's diet with a planned goal, usually designed to improve the individual's overall health.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of lactate dehydrogenase present in a sample.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of lactate dehydrogenase present in a sample.

maxo_def: The act of observing and recording the fetal heart rate for determining the baseline values or other abnormal findings.
ncit_def: The act of observing and recording the fetal heart rate for determining the baseline values or other abnormal findings.

maxo_def: Ultrasound imaging following the administration of a microbubble contrast agent.
ncit_def: Ultrasound imaging following the administration of a microbubble contrast agent.

maxo_def: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.
ncit_def: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

maxo_def: A method to assess fetal oxygenation status during labor and delivery using a noninvasive reflectance pulse oximeter. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: A method to assess fetal oxygenation status during labor and delivery using a noninvasive reflectance pulse oximeter.

maxo_def: The quantitative measurement of liver enzymes in the blood, which is useful in assessing the functional state of a patient's liver. Liver function tests include the measurement of albumin, alanine transaminase, aspartate transaminase, alkaline phosphatase, bilirubin, and gamma glutamyl transferase.
ncit_def: The quantitative measurement of liver enzymes in the blood, which is useful in assessing the functional state of a patient's liver. Liver function tests include the measurement of albumin, alanine transaminase, aspartate transaminase, alkaline phosphatase, bilirubin, and gamma glutamyl transferase.

maxo_def: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.
ncit_def: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

maxo_def: Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss.
ncit_def: Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss.

maxo_def: The determination of the absolute number of basophils in a blood sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the absolute number of basophils in a blood sample.

maxo_def: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.
ncit_def: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

maxo_def: A test or diagnostic examination to assess the health status and well being of the fetus.
ncit_def: A test or diagnostic examination to assess the health status and well being of the fetus.

maxo_def: The determination of the maximum amount of oxygen that can be combined chemically with hemoglobin in a volume of blood.
ncit_def: The determination of the maximum amount of oxygen that can be combined chemically with hemoglobin in a volume of blood.

maxo_def: The use of pharmacological and/or mechanical methods to initiate labor, including spontaneous rupture of membranes without contractions. Examples of methods include: artificial rupture of membranes, balloons, oxytocin, prostaglandin, laminaria, or other cervical ripening agents.
ncit_def: The use of pharmacological and/or mechanical methods to initiate labor, including spontaneous rupture of membranes without contractions. Examples of methods include: artificial rupture of membranes, balloons, oxytocin, prostaglandin, laminaria, or other cervical ripening agents. (adapted from reVITALize)

maxo_def: The determination of the number of erythrocytes in a blood sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the number of erythrocytes in a blood sample.

maxo_def: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.
ncit_def: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

maxo_def: The addition of one or more elements and/or chemical compounds that are either absent or deficient in an individual's daily diet.
ncit_def: The addition of one or more elements and/or chemical compounds that are either absent or deficient in an individual's daily diet.

maxo_def: Screening with a swab from the vaginal and rectal areas in late pregnancy to test for the presence of Group B streptococcal infection.
ncit_def: Screening with a swab from the vaginal and rectal areas in late pregnancy to test for the presence of Group B streptococcal infection.

maxo_def: Any one of the substituted benzimidazole compounds with anti-ulcer activity. A proton pump inhibitor is orally administered in the neutrally charged, inactive form and, upon entering the acidic environment of the parietal cell, gets protonated and converted into its active form. The active form will covalently and irreversibly bind to the proton pump, the H+/K+-ATPase, located on the surface of parietal cells. This leads to an inhibition of the transport of hydrogen ions, in exchange for potassium ions, into the gastric lumen and results in an inhibition of gastric acid secretion.
ncit_def: Any one of the substituted benzimidazole compounds with anti-ulcer activity. A proton pump inhibitor is orally administered in the neutrally charged, inactive form and, upon entering the acidic environment of the parietal cell, gets protonated and converted into its active form. The active form will covalently and irreversibly bind to the proton pump, the H+/K+-ATPase, located on the surface of parietal cells. This leads to an inhibition of the transport of hydrogen ions, in exchange for potassium ions, into the gastric lumen and results in an inhibition of gastric acid secretion.

maxo_def: Use of an agent that exerts a physiologic effect on any anatomic entity that is part of the respiratory tract and airways.
ncit_def: An agent that exerts a physiologic effect on any anatomic entity that is part of the respiratory tract and airways.

maxo_def: An in-depth evaluation of an individual's food and nutrient intake, lifestyle, and medical history designed to help the individual either maintain their health status or attain a healthier status.
ncit_def: An in-depth evaluation of an individual's food and nutrient intake, lifestyle, and medical history designed to help the individual either maintain their health status or attain a healthier status.

maxo_def: A procedure, also known as sonohysterography or saline infusion sonography, using a minimally invasive ultrasound technique to view the inside of the uterus. Sterile saline is injected into the endometrial cavity thereby distending the endometrial cavity, providing good visualization of the anatomic structures within.
ncit_def: A procedure, also known as sonohysterography or saline infusion sonography, using a minimally invasive ultrasound technique to view the inside of the uterus. Sterile saline is injected into the endometrial cavity thereby distending the endometrial cavity, providing good visualization of the anatomic structures within.

maxo_def: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.
ncit_def: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

maxo_def: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.
ncit_def: The administration of oxygen to an individual, usually to aid in respiration.

maxo_def: A minimally invasive procedure that permits sampling of peritoneal fluid for cytopathologic analysis.
ncit_def: A minimally invasive procedure that permits sampling of peritoneal fluid for cytopathologic analysis.

maxo_def: The determination of the number of eosinophils in a blood sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the number of eosinophils in a blood sample.

maxo_def: The systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data on an ongoing basis.
ncit_def: The systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data on an ongoing basis.

maxo_def: An ultrasonic examination of the fetus in the late first trimester to measure the clear space at the back of the fetal neck to assess risk of genetic or cardiac abnormalities.
ncit_def: An ultrasonic examination of the fetus in the late first trimester to measure the clear space at the back of the fetal neck to assess risk of genetic or cardiac abnormalities.

maxo_def: Procedure where the individual examines their own breasts for lumps and other changes. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: Procedure where the individual examines their own breasts for lumps and other changes.

maxo_def: The measurement of the total protein present in a urine sample that was collected over a period of 24 hours.
ncit_def: The measurement of the total protein present in a urine sample that was collected over a period of 24 hours.

maxo_def: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.
ncit_def: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

maxo_def: A therapeutic procedure used in patients with kidney failure. It involves the extracorporeal removal of harmful wastes and fluids from the blood using a dialysis machine. Following the dialysis, the blood is returned to the body.
ncit_def: A therapeutic procedure used in patients with kidney failure.  It involves the extracorporeal removal of harmful wastes and fluids from the blood using a dialysis machine.  Following the dialysis, the blood is returned to the body.

maxo_def: The determination of the number of lymphocytes in a blood sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the number of lymphocytes in a blood sample.

maxo_def: The determination of the number of reticulocytes in a blood sample. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: The determination of the number of reticulocytes in a blood sample.

maxo_def: The treatment of deformity or disease through mechanical force and movement, including both active and passive exercises, intended to ameliorate injury, increase mobility, and improve overall function.
ncit_def: The treatment of deformity or disease through mechanical force and movement, including both active and passive exercises, intended to ameliorate injury, increase mobility, and improve overall function.

maxo_def: Treatment with a medication that increases the extracellular level of the neurotransmitter serotonin (5-HT) by inhibiting its reuptake into the presynaptic cell.
ncit_def: Any agent that increases the extracellular level of the neurotransmitter serotonin (5-HT) by inhibiting its reuptake into the presynaptic cell. Increased level in the synaptic cleft prolongs the action of 5-HT on the postsynaptic receptor. This type of agent is typically used as an antidepressant and in the treatment of anxiety disorders and some personality disorders. They are also typically effective and used in treating some cases of insomnia.

maxo_def: A test that involves administration of a know quantity of glucose as a means of screening for glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus. Typically a baseline (fasting plasma or serum glucose) is drawn prior to the administration of the glucose bolus. Serial plasma glucose levels are obtained (e.g. 30min, 1hr, 2hr, 3hr) and a plot of plasma glucose versus time is created. Comparison of these values against standardized results can be used in establishing the diagnosis of glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus.
ncit_def: A test that involves administration of a know quantity of glucose as a means of screening for glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus. Typically a baseline (fasting plasma or serum glucose) is drawn prior to the administration of the glucose bolus.  Serial plasma glucose levels are obtained (e.g. 30min, 1hr, 2hr, 3hr) and a plot of plasma glucose versus time is created.  Comparison of these values against standardized results can be used in establishing the diagnosis of glucose intolerance or diabetes mellitus.

maxo_def: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.
ncit_def: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.

maxo_def: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
ncit_def: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

maxo_def: A type of MRI that takes a series of images of an organ in quick succession and statistically analyzes the differences between the images.
ncit_def: The principle of functional MRI imaging is to take a series of images of an organ in quick succession and to statistically analyze the images for differences among them.  Most commonly used in studies of brain function.

maxo_def: The determination of the amount of granulocytes present in a sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the amount of granulocytes present in a sample.

maxo_def: Washing out a hollow organ by flushing with a fluid.
ncit_def: Washing out a hollow organ (especially the stomach) by flushing with a fluid.

maxo_def: Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.
ncit_def: Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

maxo_def: A type of treatment that uses substances derived from or made by living organisms to treat disease; this includes both naturally occurring and synthetic products.
ncit_def: A type of treatment that uses substances derived from or made by living organisms to treat disease; this includes both naturally occurring and synthetic products.

maxo_def: The transplantation of fecal bacteria, via enema, colonoscopy, or other method, from a healthy individual to a recipient.
ncit_def: The transplantation of fecal bacteria, via enema, colonoscopy, or other method, from a healthy individual to a recipient.

maxo_def: The determination of the amount of degree, quality or condition of cells present in a sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the amount of degree, quality or condition of cells present in a sample.

maxo_def: Administration of nutritional support by means of a tube passed into the stomach.
ncit_def: Administration of nutritional support by means of a tube passed into the stomach.

maxo_def: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
ncit_def: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

maxo_def: A prenatal diagnostic procedure in which a small sample of amniotic fluid is removed from the uterus by a needle inserted into the abdomen. This procedure is used to detect various genetic abnormalities in the fetus and/or the sex of the fetus.
ncit_def: A prenatal diagnostic procedure in which a small sample of amniotic fluid is removed from the uterus by a needle inserted into the abdomen. This procedure is used to detect various genetic abnormalities in the fetus and/or the sex of the fetus.

maxo_def: A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.
ncit_def: A surgical procedure that places something in the human body.

maxo_def: A series of maneuvers to determine the position and presenting part of the fetus with respect to the maternal pelvic canal in preparation for labor and the birth process.
ncit_def: A series of maneuvers to determine the position and presenting part of the fetus with respect to the maternal pelvic canal in preparation for labor and the birth process.

maxo_def: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery.
ncit_def: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery.

maxo_def: An prenatal ultrasonographic method that measures blood flow velocity through either maternal or fetal vessels.
ncit_def: An antenatal ultrasonographic method that measures blood flow velocity through either maternal or fetal vessels.

maxo_def: A process by which a health professional provides education, recommendations, or interventions to help clients stop using tobacco products.
ncit_def: A process by which a health professional provides education, recommendations, or interventions to help clients stop using tobacco products. (ACC)

maxo_def: The process of gathering information regarding a person's medical history.
ncit_def: The process of gathering information regarding a person's medical history.

maxo_def: A highly sensitive technique for detecting and measuring antigens or antibodies in a solution; the solution is run over a surface to which immobilized antibodies specific to the substance have been attached, and if the substance is present, it will bind to the antibody layer, and its presence is verified and visualized with an application of antibodies that have been tagged in some way.
ncit_def: A highly sensitive technique for detecting and measuring antigens or antibodies in a solution; the solution is run over a surface to which immobilized antibodies specific to the substance have been attached, and if the substance is present, it will bind to the antibody layer, and its presence is verified and visualized with an application of antibodies that have been tagged in some way. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary)

maxo_def: The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.
ncit_def: The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.

maxo_def: A form of dialysis that uses the peritoneum as a membrane across which the infused dialysate exchanges nutrients for waste products that are removed when the fluid is exchanged.
ncit_def: A form of dialysis that uses the peritoneum as a membrane across which the infused diasylate exchanges nutrients for waste products that are removed when the fluid is exchanged.

maxo_def: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.
ncit_def: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

maxo_def: A procedure of surgical placement of a catheter, which lumen is usually occupied by a trocar, into the central vein (internal jugular, subclavian, and femoral often used) or veins, to provide vascular access for measurement of hemodynamic variables that cannot be measured accurately by noninvasive means. It also can be used to deliver medications that were too potent or too toxic to be administered through peripheral access, for parenteral nutrition delivery; and for placing wires and pulmonary artery catheters. Central veins are usually cannulated percutaneously. The procedure is associated with many adverse events and has to be performed or supervised by an experienced physician.
ncit_def: A procedure of surgical placement of a catheter, which lumen is usually occupied by a trocar, into the central vein (internal jugular, subclavian, and femoral often used) or veins, to provide vascular access for measurement of hemodynamic variables that cannot be measured accurately by noninvasive means.  It also can be used to deliver medications that were too potent or too toxic to be administered through peripheral access, for parenteral nutrition delivery; and for placing wires and pulmonary artery catheters. Central veins are usually cannulated percutaneously. The procedure is associated with many adverse events and has to be performed or supervised by an experienced physician.

maxo_def: The determination of the unmeasured anions (those other than the chloride and bicarbonate anions) present in a sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the unmeasured anions (those other than the chloride and bicarbonate anions) present in a sample.

maxo_def: Examination under a microscope of cells found in sputum (mucus and other matter brought up from the lungs by coughing). The test checks for abnormal cells, such as lung cancer cells.
ncit_def: A diagnostic technique for lung cancer detection.  Looks for abnormal cell cytology in sputum.

maxo_def: The determination of the amount of the procalcitonin in a sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the amount of the procalcitonin in a sample.

maxo_def: Treatment of cancer that utilizes antimetabolite substances to disrupt DNA, RNA, or protein synthesis.
ncit_def: Treatment of cancer that utilizes antimetabolite substances to disrupt DNA, RNA, or protein synthesis.

maxo_def: A synthetic or animal-derived form of insulin used in the treatment of diabetes mellitus. Therapeutic insulin is formulated to be short-, intermediate- and long-acting in order to individualize an insulin regimen according to individual differences in glucose and insulin metabolism. Therapeutic insulin may be derived from porcine, bovine or recombinant sources. Endogenous human insulin, a pancreatic hormone composed of two polypeptide chains, is important for the normal metabolism of carbohydrates, proteins and fats and has anabolic effects on many types of tissues.
ncit_def: A synthetic or animal-derived form of insulin used in the treatment of diabetes mellitus. Therapeutic insulin is formulated to be short-, intermediate- and long-acting in order to individualize an insulin regimen according to individual differences in glucose and insulin metabolism. Therapeutic insulin may be derived from porcine, bovine or recombinant sources. Endogenous human insulin, a pancreatic hormone composed of two polypeptide chains, is important for the normal metabolism of carbohydrates, proteins and fats and has anabolic effects on many types of tissues.

maxo_def: The determination of the saturation of iron binding sites on serum transferrin proteins. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: The determination of the saturation of iron binding sites on serum transferrin proteins.

maxo_def: The act of receiving professional guidance in resolving personal conflicts and emotional problems.
ncit_def: The act of receiving professional guidance in resolving personal conflicts and emotional problems.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of glucose present in a sample of blood, obtained from a source that has abstained from nutrition, typically at least 8 hours prior to the sample collection time.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of glucose present in a sample of blood, obtained from a source that has abstained from nutrition, typically at least 8 hours prior to the sample collection time.

maxo_def: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to remove bodily fluid or tissue.
ncit_def: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to remove bodily fluid or tissue.

maxo_def: Treatment with colony-stimulating factors (CSF) can help the blood-forming tissue recover from the effects of chemotherapy and radiation therapy. These factors include interleukin-3 (IL-3), granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF), macrophage colony-stimulating factor (M-CSF), and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF).
ncit_def: Glycoprotein growth factors produced by monocytes, macrophages, or activated lymphocytes that stimulate the proliferation of bone marrow cells and differentiation of stem cells into colonies of granulocytes, monocytes, or macrophages.  These substances act in either paracrine or autocrine fashion on marrow cells, appear to act synergistically in complex and poorly understood ways.  Each appears to exert actions on several lines of progenitor cells and to influence end cell function.  Treatment with colony-stimulating factors (CSF) can help the blood-forming tissue recover from the effects of chemotherapy and radiation therapy.  These factors include interleukin-3 (IL-3), granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF), macrophage colony-stimulating factor (M-CSF), and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF).

maxo_def: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
ncit_def: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

maxo_def: An invasive procedure in which sound waves (called ultrasound) are bounced off of vascular tissues from within the vessel and the echoes produce a picture (sonogram).
ncit_def: An invasive procedure in which sound waves (called ultrasound) are bounced off of vascular tissues from within the vessel and the echoes produce a picture (sonogram).

maxo_def: Treatment of retroviral infections with medications that target the virus directly, limiting the ability of infected cells to produce new virus particles.
ncit_def: Treatment of retroviral infections with medications that target the virus directly, limiting the ability of infected cells to produce new virus particles.

maxo_def: A test to determine the number of leukocytes in a sample of blood.
ncit_def: A test to determine the number of leukocytes in a sample of blood.

maxo_def: The practice of piercing specific points on the body with very thin sterile needles in order to relieve pain or induce regional anesthesia.
ncit_def: The practice of piercing specific points on the body with very thin sterile needles in order to relieve pain or induce regional anesthesia.

maxo_def: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.
ncit_def: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.

maxo_def: A non-invasive method that provides estimates of arterial oxyhemoglobin saturation by utilizing selected wavelengths of light to determine the saturation of oxyhemoglobin.
ncit_def: A non-invasive method that provides estimates of arterial oxyhemoglobin saturation by utilizing selected wavelengths of light to determine the saturation of oxyhemoglobin.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of a particular substance present in a sample of serum. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of a particular substance present in a sample of serum.

maxo_def: An alternative medical system that focuses on the relationship between bodily structure (primarily that of the spine) and function, and how that relationship affects the preservation and restoration of health. Chiropractors use manipulative therapy as an integral treatment tool.
ncit_def: An alternative medical system that focuses on the relationship between bodily structure (primarily that of the spine) and function, and how that relationship affects the preservation and restoration of health. Chiropractors use manipulative therapy as an integral treatment tool.

maxo_def: Substance that may reduce inflammation, stimulate elimination of uric acid, or increase production of uric acid.
ncit_def: Pharmaceutical Anti-gout Preparations such as colchicine, allopurinol, probenecid, and sulfinpyrazone contain natural or synthetic agents against gout, a condition characterized by increased uric acid accumulation. Anti-gout agents may reduce inflammation, stimulate elimination of uric acid, or increase production of uric acid. (NCI04)

maxo_def: Any medical procedure used to sustain the life of a patient in critical condition.
ncit_def: Any medical procedure used to sustain the life of a patient in critical condition.

maxo_def: An examination or assessment of the form and structure of red blood cells. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: An examination or assessment of the form and structure of red blood cells.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of total protein present in serum.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the total amount of protein present in a sample of serum.

maxo_def: The act of assessing an individual's current temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, pulse oxygenation, and blood pressure.
ncit_def: The act of assessing an individual's current temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, pulse oxygenation, and blood pressure.

maxo_def: A term that refers to a chemistry test measuring a specific protein or enzyme in the peripheral blood or body fluid.
ncit_def: A term that refers to a chemistry test measuring a specific protein or enzyme in the peripheral blood or body fluid.

maxo_def: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.
ncit_def: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.

maxo_def: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
ncit_def: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of a particular substance present in a sample of urine. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of a particular substance present in a sample of urine.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of phosphate present in a sample of serum.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of phosphate present in a sample of serum.

maxo_def: A therapeutic method of manipulation, methodical pressure, friction, and kneading of the body.
ncit_def: A therapeutic method of manipulation, methodical pressure, friction, and kneading of the body. (from Taber's)

maxo_def: A technique for analyzing or identifying proteins immobilized on a filter by complementary reaction with specific antibodies.
ncit_def: A technique for analyzing or identifying proteins immobilized on a filter by complementary reaction with specific antibodies.

maxo_def: An antineoplastic agent that replaces hydrogen atom(s) in nucleophilic moieties with alky radical(s), hindering proper function. Alkylating agents exhibit cytotoxic effects through the alkylation of DNA, resulting in strand cross-linking, ultimately inhibiting DNA replication and cancer cell growth.
ncit_def: An antineoplastic agent that replaces hydrogen atom(s) in nucleophilic moieties with alky radical(s), hindering proper function. Alkylating agents exhibit cytotoxic effects through the alkylation of DNA, resulting in strand cross-linking, ultimately inhibiting DNA replication and cancer cell growth.

maxo_def: A technique that utilizes a wire attached to the fetal scalp to monitor fetal heart rate. The wire detects fetal cardiac electrical activity to determine the baseline fetal heart rate and variability. [ NICHD NCI ]
ncit_def: A technique that utilizes a wire attached to the fetal scalp to monitor fetal heart rate. The wire detects fetal cardiac electrical activity to determine the baseline fetal heart rate and variability.

maxo_def: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination. This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.
ncit_def: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.

maxo_def: The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.
ncit_def: The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.

maxo_def: Continuous and profound contemplation or musing on a subject or series of subjects of a deep or abstruse nature; contemplation of spiritual matters.
ncit_def: Continuous and profound contemplation or musing on a subject or series of subjects of a deep or abstruse nature; contemplation of spiritual matters

maxo_def: Counseling designed to guide and support an individual to overcome alcohol dependence.
ncit_def: Counseling designed to guide and support an individual to overcome alcohol dependence.

maxo_def: The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in the blood.
ncit_def: The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in the blood.

maxo_def: The determination of the amount of haptoglobin protein present in a sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the amount of haptoglobin protein present in a sample.

maxo_def: An endoscopic technique that allows deep intubation of the small intestine while using a standard endoscope. An inflatable balloon attached to the endoscope's tip acts as a stabilizer and a second balloon that is advanced ahead of the endoscope acts as a pulling device.
ncit_def: An endoscopic technique that allows deep intubation of the small intestine while using a standard endoscope. An inflatable balloon attached to the endoscope's tip acts as a stabilizer and a second balloon that is advanced ahead of the endoscope acts as a pulling device.

maxo_def: A measurement of the time it takes a plasma sample to clot after adding the active enzyme thrombin. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: A measurement of the time it takes a plasma sample to clot after adding the active enzyme thrombin.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of albumin present in a sample.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of albumin present in a sample.

maxo_def: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of a tumor, usually before there are any symptoms.
ncit_def: The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of a tumor, usually before there are any symptoms.

maxo_def: A medical recommendation of sustained exercise that places an increased oxygen demand on the cardiovascular system and promotes an increased efficiency of the body's use of oxygen.
ncit_def: Sustained exercise that places an increased oxygen demand on the cardiovascular system and promotes an increased efficiency of the body's use of oxygen.

maxo_def: A form of non-invasive mechanical pressure support ventilation that uses a continuous positive airway pressure level to support spontaneous breathing activity.
ncit_def: A form of non-invasive mechanical pressure support ventilation that uses a continuous positive airway pressure level to support spontaneous breathing activity.

maxo_def: A surgical procedure by which tissue or an organ (usually containing a tumor) is removed without rupture from a specific anatomic site.
ncit_def: A surgical procedure by which tissue or an organ (usually containing a tumor) is removed without rupture from a specific anatomic site.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement for assessing the amount of glucose present in a blood sample.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement for assessing the amount of glucose present in a blood sample.

maxo_def: A form of non-invasive mechanical pressure support ventilation that uses a time-cycled change of the applied positive airway pressure level to support spontaneous breathing activity.
ncit_def: A form of non-invasive mechanical pressure support ventilation that uses a time-cycled change of the applied positive airway pressure level to support spontaneous breathing activity.

maxo_def: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.
ncit_def: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.

maxo_def: The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.
ncit_def: The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.

maxo_def: The process whereby an expert in hereditary disorders provides information about risk and clinical burden of a disorder or disorders to patients or relatives in families with genetic disorders as an aid to making informed and responsible decisions about marriage, children, early diagnosis, and handling disability.
ncit_def: The process whereby an expert in hereditary disorders provides information about risk and clinical burden of a disorder or disorders to patients or relatives in families with genetic disorders as an aid to making informed and responsible decisions about marriage, children, early diagnosis, and handling disability.

maxo_def: A test for the presence of fetal fibronectin in the cervico-vaginal area that is used to predict preterm birth.
ncit_def: A test for the presence of fetal fibronectin in the cervico-vaginal area that is used to predict preterm birth.

maxo_def: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
ncit_def: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

maxo_def: A minimally-invasive procedure that permits sampling of breast ductal fluids for cytopathologic analysis.
ncit_def: A minimally-invasive procedure that permits sampling of breast ductal fluids for cytopathologic analysis.

maxo_def: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
ncit_def: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of human chorionic gonadotropin present in a sample of serum.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of human chorionic gonadotropin present in a sample of serum.

maxo_def: A surgical procedure to treat and correct deformities, diseases, and injuries to the skeletal system, its articulations, and associated structures.
ncit_def: A surgical procedure to treat and correct deformities, diseases, and injuries to the skeletal system, its articulations, and associated structures.

maxo_def: A measure of the volume of red blood cells expressed as a percentage of the total blood volume. Normal in males is 43-49%, in females 37-43%.
ncit_def: A measure of the volume of red blood cells expressed as a percentage of the total blood volume. Normal in males is 43-49%, in females 37-43%.

maxo_def: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.
ncit_def: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation.

maxo_def: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.
ncit_def: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.

maxo_def: The determination of the amount of 5 prime nucleotidase present in a sample.
ncit_def: The determination of the amount of 5 prime nucleotidase present in a sample.

maxo_def: A type of nucleic acid amplification test in which sample DNA is exposed to a single temperature in the presence of multiple sets of primers and a polymerase with replication and high strand displacement activity. This test negates the need for thermal cyclers and may be a low cost alternative to PCR.
ncit_def: A type of nucleic acid amplification test in which sample DNA is exposed to a single temperature in the presence of multiple sets of primers and a polymerase with replication and high strand displacement activity. This test negates the need for thermal cyclers and may be a low cost alternative to PCR.

maxo_def: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
ncit_def: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

maxo_def: A screening measurement in which the maternal blood levels of alpha-fetoprotein, unconjugated estriol, human chorionic gonadotrophin and Inhibin A are calculated. These are then evaluated in relation to the mother's age, weight and fetal gestational age.
ncit_def: A screening measurement in which the maternal blood levels of alpha-fetoprotein, unconjugated estriol, human chorionic gonadotrophin and Inhibin A are calculated. These are then evaluated in relation to the mother's age, weight and fetal gestational age.

maxo_def: Washing out the bronchi and alveoli by flushing with a fluid.
ncit_def: Washing out the bronchi and alveoli by flushing with a fluid.

maxo_def: Treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.
ncit_def: Treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.

maxo_def: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
ncit_def: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

maxo_def: Any form of treatment that acts to improve or assist with respiratory function.
ncit_def: Any form of treatment that acts to improve or assist with respiratory function.

maxo_def: The collecting of secretions and superficial cells of the body of uterus, cervix, and ovaries; examined with a microscope to detect any abnormal cells.
ncit_def: A biospecimen collection and staining procedure in which secretions and superficial cells of the cervix are collected and stained with the Papanicolaou stain followed by microscopic examination to identify the presence of abnormal cells.

maxo_def: The removal of a previously inserted tube from a hollow organ or passageway, often from the airway.
ncit_def: The removal of a previously inserted tube from a hollow organ or passageway, often from the airway.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.

maxo_def: A low-cost, high-resolution imaging tool consisting of a 1-mm diameter fiber-optic bundle that produces subcellular imaging at 1,000x magnification and 4 micrometer resolution, allowing for minimally invasive bioimaging.
ncit_def: A low-cost, high-resolution imaging tool consisting of a 1-mm diameter fiber-optic bundle that produces subcellular imaging at 1,000x magnification and 4 micrometer resolution, allowing for minimally invasive bioimaging.

maxo_def: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
ncit_def: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

maxo_def: A technique that utilizes a Doppler transducer to monitor fetal heart rate. The transducer is placed on the maternal abdomen and detects fetal cardiac motion using ultrasound. [ NICHD NCI ]
ncit_def: A technique that utilizes a Doppler transducer to monitor fetal heart rate. The transducer is placed on the maternal abdomen and detects fetal cardiac motion using ultrasound.

maxo_def: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
ncit_def: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

maxo_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of hemoglobin present in a biospecimen. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: A quantitative measurement of the amount of hemoglobin present in a sample.

maxo_def: Delivery of enteral nutrition via a tube placed into the stomach, duodenum, or jejunum.
ncit_def: Delivery of enteral nutrition via a tube placed into the stomach, duodenum, or jejunum.

maxo_def: The determination of the measured concentrations of chemical constituents of the blood by assay in a clinical laboratory. [ NCI ]
ncit_def: The determination of the measured concentrations of chemical constituents of the blood by assay in a clinical laboratory.

maxo_def: Endoscopy that employs the use of tissue stains to increase tissue contrast, and enhance the ability to identify various tissue dysplasia and other abnormalities.
ncit_def: Endoscopy that employs the use of tissue stains to increase tissue contrast, and enhance the ability to identify various tissue dysplasia and other abnormalities.

maxo_def: The removal of T-cells from the donor's hematopoietic stem cell specimen prior to its transfusion into the recipient.
ncit_def: The removal of T-cells from the donor's hematopoietic stem cell specimen prior to its transfusion into the recipient.

maxo_def: Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure for the diagnosis or treatment of a disease.
ncit_def: Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure; usually involves microscopic examination of tissue slices.

maxo_def: A laboratory procedure that tests the function of an endocrine organ and measures the amount of a hormone present in a sample.
ncit_def: A laboratory procedure that tests the function of an endocrine organ and measures the amount of a hormone present in a sample.
